title: KindKart UI refresh: necessity item terminology, NGO nav fixes, user delivery section, testimonials, seller ratings, donation budget, and checkout donate/anonymity + payment details

requirements.summary: Retitle marketplace UI language from “Products” to “Necessity Items” while keeping all existing routes unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: User-facing text in marketplace/browse/product-related pages uses 'Necessity Items' instead of 'Products' (where semantically applicable).
No routes break; existing navigation continues to work.

file_operations.description: Update headings, search placeholder, and any marketplace copy to use “Necessity Items” instead of “Products” without changing navigation behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update product detail user-facing copy (including not-found messaging and CTAs where applicable) to use “Necessity Item(s)” terminology while keeping the same /user/product/$productId route. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update public browsing page text (title, search placeholder, CTA) from “Products” to “Necessity Items”, keeping route /browse intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update landing page CTA/button label(s) such as “Browse Products” to “Browse Necessity Items” while preserving links and routes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update global search placeholder text to refer to “Necessity Items” rather than “products” while preserving search routing to /user/marketplace. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update user navigation labels where semantically applicable (e.g., “Sell Product” -> “List Necessity Item”) without changing any paths. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Fix NGO navbar links so “Post Requirements” and “Delivery Tracking” navigate to existing routes instead of Not Found.
acceptanceCriteria: NGO navbar 'Post Requirements' links to /ngo/requirements/post (not /ngo/requirements).
NGO navbar 'Delivery Tracking' links to /ngo/deliveries (not /ngo/tracking).
Navigating via NGO navbar no longer results in a Not Found state for these destinations.

file_operations.description: Update NGONavbar navItems paths to /ngo/requirements/post and /ngo/deliveries to match the router configuration. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add an end-user Delivery section that lists deliveries with statuses and links into the existing trackingId-based tracking details route.
acceptanceCriteria: A user-accessible page/section lists the user’s deliveries with clear statuses (e.g., scheduled, picked-up, in-transit, delivered) using seeded/dummy data.
Each listed delivery provides a working link/button to open the existing tracking details route (/tracking/$trackingId).

file_operations.description: Create a user deliveries page that reads seeded/dummy deliveries from DeliveriesContext, renders delivery cards with clear status badges, and links each item to /tracking/$trackingId using the delivery’s id as trackingId. Use shadcn/ui Card/Badge/Button for consistent UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Register a new authenticated user route for the deliveries page (e.g., /user/deliveries) and wire it into the route tree so it is navigable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a “Deliveries” navigation item pointing to the new /user/deliveries route to ensure the page is reachable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a prominent public testimonials section with at least 4 dummy testimonials including star ratings.
acceptanceCriteria: A testimonials UI section is visible on the public site and contains at least 4 dummy testimonials.
Each testimonial shows a name and a short quote; ratings are visually represented (e.g., stars).

file_operations.description: Create a TestimonialsSection component rendering at least 4 dummy testimonials (name, role/type, quote, numeric rating) and visually represent ratings with star icons (e.g., lucide-react Star). Use shadcn/ui Card for layout consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Place the new TestimonialsSection in a prominent location on the landing page (e.g., after Features and before CTA) to ensure it is visible on the public site. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Show consistent seller authenticity star ratings and review summaries on both marketplace listings and item detail views using dummy data.
acceptanceCriteria: Marketplace list cards show a seller rating (stars) and a review count (dummy values).
Product detail page shows seller rating (stars) and a short review summary/list (dummy values).
Ratings display is consistent across marketplace and product detail.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable SellerRating component that displays a star rating UI and review count, backed by deterministic dummy data derived from seller/product identifiers. Use shadcn/ui + lucide-react for consistent presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a small reusable SellerReviewSummary component that shows a short dummy review list/summary for the seller, formatted consistently with SellerRating. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render SellerRating on each necessity item card wherever seller info is implied/shown, displaying stars + review count with dummy values. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render SellerRating and SellerReviewSummary in the seller info area so the detail view shows consistent stars, review count, and a short dummy review summary/list. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure the item detail view always shows a clear description section with a graceful fallback when missing.
acceptanceCriteria: Product detail page includes a labeled description area that renders non-empty text for all seeded items (use fallback text if needed).
No product detail page appears without a description block.

file_operations.description: Add a labeled “Description” section (e.g., Card/section) and ensure it always renders non-empty text by applying a sensible fallback when product.description is missing/blank. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a donor budgeting UI that lets donors set a budget and shows recommended necessity items client-side (UI-only).
acceptanceCriteria: There is an input/control for budget amount (currency consistent with the app) in an appropriate donation flow page.
Recommended items list updates client-side based on the entered budget (e.g., filters/sorts dummy recommended items that fit within budget).
No backend calls are required for generating recommendations.

file_operations.description: Create a DonationBudgetPlanner UI component with a budget input (₹) that filters/sorts a dummy recommended necessity items list client-side (e.g., using products from KindKartDataContext) to show items within budget. Use shadcn/ui Input/Card/Badge for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Embed DonationBudgetPlanner into the donation flow (e.g., above the NGO grid) so donors can set a budget and immediately see recommended necessity items without any backend calls. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update marketplace purchase initiation so users choose “Buy for yourself” vs “Donate”, and if donating must choose anonymity vs show name before continuing.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking 'Buy Now' (or equivalent) opens a choice between 'Buy for yourself' and 'Donate'.
If 'Donate' is chosen, the UI requires selecting either anonymous donation or showing donor name before continuing.
The selection is reflected in the UI summary/confirmation step (e.g., 'Donor: Anonymous' vs 'Donor: <Name>').

file_operations.description: Create a CheckoutIntentDialog component that opens from the product detail CTA and enforces a two-step choice: (1) intent: buy vs donate; (2) if donate, require anonymity selection (anonymous vs show my name) before proceeding. Use shadcn/ui Dialog + form controls for a consistent flow. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace the current direct-action buttons with a single “Buy / Donate” (or equivalent) that opens CheckoutIntentDialog; ensure the dialog prevents continuing until required selections are made and shows a confirmation summary including donor identity selection. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Show coherent dummy payment details (breakdown + payer/donor details) during both buying and donating flows, reflecting anonymity when applicable.
acceptanceCriteria: Donation flow shows a payment details panel/section before confirming submission (amount breakdown + donor info).
Marketplace purchase/donate flow shows a payment details panel/section before confirming (cost breakdown + recipient/delivery notes as dummy text if needed).
All values can be dummy but must be coherent and non-empty.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable PaymentDetailsPanel component that shows a coherent dummy breakdown (item/donation amount, dummy fees, total) and payer/donor details (including anonymity state). Use shadcn/ui Card/Separator/Badge for readability. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a payment details section before the final “Complete Donation” action using PaymentDetailsPanel, showing amount breakdown and donor info (respecting the anonymous toggle). Keep payment UI-only with coherent dummy fees/totals. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Integrate PaymentDetailsPanel into the marketplace buy/donate dialog confirmation step to show cost breakdown plus dummy recipient/delivery notes and donor anonymity selection when applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Populate dashboards/analytics and delivery-related UIs with realistic dummy data so views don’t appear empty, including map-like visuals with dummy markers/details (no external map integration).
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboards/analytics pages across roles (User/NGO/Delivery/Admin) render non-empty dummy datasets (lists and chart values).
Any map UI shown in delivery-related pages uses dummy route/markers and accompanying details (no external map integration required).
No primary page presents an empty state unless it is explicitly a 'no data' scenario with explanatory copy.

file_operations.description: Replace zero/empty KPI placeholders with realistic dummy totals and add at least one additional non-empty visualization (e.g., simple bar list by month/program) so the page no longer appears empty. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Populate NGO delivery tracking with a non-empty dummy deliveries list (and status badges) instead of “No active deliveries”, and include brief dummy route/ETA details to avoid placeholder-only UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure charts remain non-empty and adjust any hardcoded chart styling to match the refreshed warm palette (avoid blue/purple-centric colors) while keeping dummy datasets coherent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Include non-empty dummy route/stop details per delivery (textual markers like pickup/drop labels and ETA) and optionally a small static preview using existing patterns (no external maps) to satisfy delivery-related dummy map/marker guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive warm/neutral visual theme refresh across updated sections with consistent typography/spacing and avoid blue/purple-centric styling; ensure all UI text is English.
acceptanceCriteria: New/updated UI sections share consistent component styling (cards, badges, headings, spacing).
Theme uses a warm/neutral palette (e.g., earth tones) and does not default to a blue/purple-centric look.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Update CSS theme tokens (e.g., --primary/--ring and related chart tokens) from purple/blue hues to a warm, trustworthy earth-tone palette; keep contrast accessible for both light and dark modes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align newly added testimonials section and existing landing sections to the refreshed warm theme using consistent spacing, headings, and card styling (no blue/purple-centric visuals). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust marketplace cards/badges/typography to match the refreshed warm theme (consistent spacing and readable hierarchy) while keeping routes intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure description block, seller rating UI, and checkout/payment panels follow consistent card/badge styling and warm palette. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure donation budget planner and donation-related cards use consistent warm theme styling (cards, badges, headings). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure payment details panel and donor info display match the warm theme and consistent layout conventions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace any blue/purple chart bar classes with warm/neutral alternatives (e.g., amber/emerald/orange) to match the refreshed palette while preserving dummy data integrity. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
